Note: Only one selected option is allowed. If more than one option is defined as selected, the last one would be considered as the selected one.

Note: Use the sap.ui.webc.main.Option component to define the desired options.

removeLabel.!description: Removes a label from the aggregation {@link #getLabel label}.
removeLabel.!type: fn(vLabel: Number | String | sap.ui.core.Control) -> sap.ui.core.Control | null

parameters.vLabel: type: int|string|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The label to remove or its index or id

detachOpen.!description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:open open} event of this sap.ui.webc.main.Select. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.
detachOpen.!type: fn(fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.webc.main.Select

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object on which the given function had to be called
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

fireLiveChange.!description: Fires event {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

indexOfOption.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.webc.main.ISelectOption in the aggregation {@link #getOptions options}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oOption: type: sap.ui.webc.main.ISelectOption, description: The option whose index is looked for

setName.!description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getName name}. Determines the name with which the component will be submitted in an HTML form. The value of the component will be the value of the currently selected sap.ui.webc.main.Option.

Note: When set, a native input HTML element will be created inside the sap.ui.webc.main.Select so that it can be submitted as part of an HTML form. Do not use this property unless you need to submit a form. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

parameters.sName: type: string, description: New value for property name

removeAllAriaLabelledBy.!description: Removes all the controls in the association named {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

removeAllOptions.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getOptions options}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

fireOpen.!description: Fires event {@link #event:open open} to attached listeners.

parameters.mParameters: type: object, description: Parameters to pass along with the event

attachOpen.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:open open} event of this sap.ui.webc.main.Select. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.webc.main.Select itself. Fired after the component's dropdown menu opens.
attachOpen.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.webc.main.Select

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.webc.main.Select itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

getWidth.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}.

Defines the width of the control

attachLiveChange.!description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} event of this sap.ui.webc.main.Select. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.webc.main.Select itself. Fired when the user navigates through the options, but the selection is not finalized, or when pressing the ESC key to revert the current selection.
attachLiveChange.!type: fn(oData?: Object, fnFunction: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, oListener?: Object) -> sap.ui.webc.main.Select

parameters.oListener: type: object, description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.webc.main.Select itself
parameters.fnFunction: type: function(sap.ui.base.Event) : void, description: The function to be called when the event occurs
parameters.oData: type: object, description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

sap.ui.webc.main.Select.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Select. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getAccessibleName accessibleName} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getEnabled enabled} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getName name} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getRequired required} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getValueState valueState} : sap.ui.core.ValueState (default: None)
    • {@link #getValueStateMessage valueStateMessage} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getLabel label} : sap.ui.core.Control[]
    • {@link #getOptions options} : sap.ui.webc.main.ISelectOption[] (default)
  • Associations
    • {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)[]
    • {@link #getMenu menu} : (sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control)
  • Events
    • {@link #event:change change} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:close close} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:liveChange liveChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:open open} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.webc.WebComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.webc.WebComponent} can be used as well.

addAriaLabelledBy.!description: Adds some ariaLabelledBy into the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getEnabled.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnabled enabled}. Defines whether the control is enabled. A disabled control can't be interacted with, and it is not in the tab chain. Default value is true.

getMenu.!description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getMenu menu}, or null.

removeAriaLabelledBy.!description: Removes an ariaLabelledBy from the association named {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.
removeAriaLabelledBy.!type: fn(vAriaLabelledBy: Number | sap.ui.core.ID | sap.ui.core.Control) -> sap.ui.core.ID | null

parameters.vAriaLabelledBy: type: int|sap.ui.core.ID|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The ariaLabelledBy to be removed or its index or ID

removeAllLabel.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getLabel label}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

insertOption.!description: Inserts a option into the aggregation {@link #getOptions options}.

parameters.oOption: type: sap.ui.webc.main.ISelectOption, description: The option to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the option should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the option is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the option is inserted at the last position

setWidth.!description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getWidth width}. Defines the width of the control When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sWidth: type: sap.ui.core.CSSSize, description: New value for property width

addOption.!description: Adds some option to the aggregation {@link #getOptions options}.

parameters.oOption: type: sap.ui.webc.main.ISelectOption, description: The option to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

getValueState.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getValueState valueState}. Defines the value state of the component.

Available options are:
  • None
  • Error
  • Warning
  • Success
  • Information
Default value is None.

getRequired.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRequired required}. Defines whether the component is required. Default value is false.

getValueStateMessage.!description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getValueStateMessage valueStateMessage}. Defines the value state message that will be displayed as pop up under the contorl.

Note: If not specified, a default text (in the respective language) will be displayed. Default value is empty string.

indexOfLabel.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation {@link #getLabel label}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oLabel: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The label whose index is looked for

insertLabel.!description: Inserts a label into the aggregation {@link #getLabel label}.

parameters.oLabel: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The label to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted
parameters.iIndex: type: int, description: The 0-based index the label should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the label is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the label is inserted at the last position

sap.ui.webc.main.SelectMenuOption.!description:
Deprecated! Since 1.120 this Web Components consumption model has been discarded. Until an alternative Web Components consumption model is available in the future, use sap.m and sap.f controls with similar functionality.

Overview

The code>ui5-select-menu-option component represents an option in the sap.ui.webc.main.SelectMenu.

Usage

getMetadata.!description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.webc.main.SelectMenuOption.

indexOfContent.!description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.core.Control in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content whose index is looked for

getContent.!description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}. Defines the content of the component.

Defines the text, displayed inside the sap.ui.webc.main.Select input filed when the option gets selected. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

parameters.sDisplayText: type: string, description: New value for property displayText

removeAllContent.!description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

addContent.!description: Adds some content to the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

parameters.oContent: type: sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

removeContent.!description: Removes a content from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.
removeContent.!type: fn(vContent: Number | String | sap.ui.core.Control) -> sap.ui.core.Control | null

parameters.vContent: type: int|string|sap.ui.core.Control, description: The content to remove or its index or id

extend.!description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.webc.main.SelectMenuOption with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.core.webc.WebComponent.extend}.
extend.!type: fn(sClassName: String, oClassInfo?: Object, FNMetaImpl?: fn()) -> fn()

parameters.oClassInfo: type: object, description: Object literal with information about the class
parameters.FNMetaImpl: type: function, description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class
parameters.sClassName: type: string, description: Name of the class being created

getValue.!description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValue value}. Defines the value of the sap.ui.webc.main.Select inside an HTML Form element when this component is selected. For more information on HTML Form support, see the name property of sap.ui.webc.main.Select.

sap.ui.webc.main.SelectMenuOption.!constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new SelectMenuOption. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDisplayText displayText} : string
    • {@link #getValue value} : string
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getContent content} : sap.ui.core.Control[] (default)
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.webc.WebComponent#constructor sap.ui.core.webc.WebComponent} can be used as well.
